posts.title: US IRS planning to rescind Harvard's tax-exempt status
top_comments: This is going to be drawn out in court for a long time. Harvard isn't likely to back down.

Isn't it illegal for the president to get the IRS to do that?

"Prohibition on executive branch influence over taxpayer audits and other investigations"

[Stated here](https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/26/7217)
All is fair then when the shoe is on the other foot...every church that participated in preaching about voting (at all for anyone) should lose their tax exempt status too
That's great! That means the next time we have a democratic president in we can just start pulling the tax exempt status of churches right? Just whomever we don't like?

Remember when conservatives cried persecution because the IRS showed extra scrutiny to conservative groups based on keyword usage? (The IRS also did the same for liberal groups as well but conservatives just ignored that since it didn't support their worldview)
How about megachurches next?
"The essence of fascism is to make laws forbidding everything and then enforce them selectively against your enemies." - John Lescroart, A Plague of Secrets.
Harvard may know some lawyers who can represent them in court.

Oh, good.  The dollar is collapsing, U.S. bonds are becoming more unstable and disfavored globally every day, stock market volatility is off the charts with every indication that the bottom is going to fall out, the FED chairman just cautioned that Trump's tariffs are putting the country on track for devastating stagflation ... and instead of dealing with any of this the White House is hyper-focused on abusing the power of the federal government to exact petty retributions against perceived political enemies.  Any Trump supporters want to defend this daily shitshow?

I'm very glad Harvard decided to be the one to stick out its neck. I was having conversations with my former colleagues at smaller state universities at the R2 level. Many wanted to defy the federal government but did not have the resource to do so. Now that Harvard did this and MIT followed suit, a lot more universities can just follow their footsteps. White House cannot possibly target every single college.

*"Republican lawmakers and commercial tax preparation companies complained it was a waste of taxpayer money"*  

The places that are making money from filing taxes and selling peoples information are saying it's a waste of taxpayer money.   As a taxpayer I disagree with them.

“We want the worst for everyone!”

“We are just plain evil”

> The program developed during Joe Biden’s presidency was credited by users with making tax filing easy, fast and economical. But Republican lawmakers and commercial tax preparation companies complained it was a waste of taxpayer money because free filing programs already exist, although they are hard to use.

People who like this software: users

People who don’t: Republican lawmakers and tax preparation software companies (TurboTax)

Pick a side, folks.
What if I just don't do my taxes correctly like him?

MAGA : Let's remove DirectFile, which people like and makes sense.

MAGA : Let's not go after TurboTax though, which is outright scamming us.
Every decision, the benefit of our enemies.
I filed my taxes with this in less than 30 minutes and got my return in less than week. Obviously its a terrible inefficient program that needs to go. /s
It cost $100 to file taxes under H&R Block services. That is insane when the IRS already has our information! It’s ridiculous.
I wonder how much Intuit and H&R Block paid for this. It doesn't help anyone but them to get rid of this service.
Been using freetaxusa

posts.title: Tesla whistleblower wins latest legal battle in fight against Musk
top_comments: As someone who was also diagnosed with an advanced cancer at a young age, I am in awe of this woman.  She is doing a good, but extremely challenging thing during her darkest days.  I’m routing for her, and hope she gets a resolution sooner rather than later.  I’m also wishing her positive outcomes with her treatment and outcome battling cancer.

posts.title: Congestion pricing is working': MTA says tolls keeping 82k drivers a day out of Manhattan
top_comments: Wait…What happened to “congestion pricing is dead. Long live the king!”?
For me driving in Manhattan was enough to keep me from driving in Manhattan. What a nightmare.

I was just in the city the other week and the amount of cars was WAY down. It was noticable. But you know what? The town was still busy as hell and taxis, subways and busses were moving right along. The people that needed or wanted to be there were there.
$9 per day sounds pretty reasonable. Was that all that was required to deter 2.5 million vehicles compared to last March?
Wait, it's working? I assume Trump will immediately try to end it.
The Trump administration literally just wants to undo everything good, it's fucking disgusting

I was pissed when I heard about this being implemented, being an out-of-towner going to NYC is already an expensive affair with all the tolled highways, bridges and tunnels. But it was the first time ever that I was able to drive into Manhattan and not feel like I was suffocating in traffic. I was even able to find free parking on like 48th st. Nuts.

This has my full support.

As a person who drives a car (and isn't made of money), I hate the idea of congestion pricing.

As a person who hates traffic and doesn't like pollution, I love the idea of congestion pricing.

I've got mixed feelings about it, but if it works it works I suppose?
I just hope that the MTA uses this money wisely.

Ongoing case: [https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69652290/metropolitan-transportation-authority-v-duffy/](https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69652290/metropolitan-transportation-authority-v-duffy/)

One of at least 195 against this administration ... [https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/](https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/)

posts.title: California the 1st state to sue Trump administration over tariffs
top_comments: Makes a lot of sense. Out of the 50 states, California has the largest economy — the tariffs would significantly impact the golden state

California is getting specifically targeted/fucked by Trump. National parks, tourism, trade, agriculture (the water thing). 

Makes me want to not pay my federal taxes. Not like anyone works at the IRS anymore.
LETS GO Washington, Oregon, Illinois... get on board with this.
Here's to hoping he gets a preliminary injunction. The Supreme Court will side with Trump in the end, but not if Republicans finally grow a spine and help pass a bill that limits Trump's powers.

Hope the rest follow suit.


Make him regret this.
As ashamed as I am to be American these days, I'm proud to be a Californian.
What use is a lawsuit to someone who doesn’t even have to obey the Supreme Court?
Sue his ass for everything at this point

Proud to live in California. Just watched Newsom’s news conference on it. Really good points made. 

“President can’t do unlawful things.” Damn right.

ETA: Some of the people here don’t know the history of what happens when Cali sues Trump. 

California has brought over 100 lawsuits against Trump—a majority being during Trump 1.0. 15 so far for Trump 2.0. And in many of those, gains have been made. Lawsuits can work and do work. So it’s not a waste of time for them to be doing this. If anything they’ve fired the first shot, other states will hopefully follow.

I don't think this lawsuit will go anywhere, and will probably be thrown out since tariffs are an international issue with the federal government, not with states.

But more power to him to try.

The science and learning don't matter. Only hate.... Welcome to Trump's America
The shit stain country gets shit stainier every day
Lots of people here clearly don't know how endowments work.

https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/15/us/politics/trump-harvard-tax-status.html
“Perhaps Harvard should lose its Tax Exempt Status and be Taxed as a Political Entity if it keeps pushing political, ideological, and terrorist inspired/supporting ‘Sickness?’” Mr. Trump posted on Truth Social on Tuesday morning.

Federal law prohibits the president from “directly or indirectly” telling the I.R.S. to conduct specific tax investigations:

26 U.S. Code § 7217 - Prohibition on executive branch influence over taxpayer audits and other investigations
Wait, why is euthanizing the first solution?
They want all the research, innovation and development here  but then cut off all funding and grants for the stupidest reasons. There is NO way we will beat China in the trade war.
i will take the animals :(

Just a reminder that the Trump administration NIH grant cuts are coming after state schools without big endowments too.

"But Harvard has money!!!" is not a defense of these illegal grant cuts, it's just the reason why they have the resources to fight back.
See to most people this headline sounds like bad news, but to republicans and MAGA not only do smart people lose their jobs but animals die too so for them it's a double win.

posts.title: Trade war fallout: Cancellations of Chinese freight ships begin as bookings plummet
top_comments:
This is the fault of Congress. 

For four years Trump was able to make irrational demands and Congress obeyed with no question or hesitation. So Trump and his team just assumed that other nations would bow down just as easily also. 

But, unlike our spineless congress, other nations are not going to sacrifice their citizens or destroy themselves just to appease a bully.

A total of 80 blank, or canceled, sailings out of China have been recorded by freight company HLS Group. It wrote in a recent note to clients that with the trade war between China and the U.S. leading to a demand plummet, carriers have started to suspend or adjust transpacific services.

The impact of the diminished freight container traffic to North America will be significant for many links in the economy and supply chain, including the ports and logistics companies moving the freight. If each sailing was carrying 8,000 to 10,000 TEUs (twenty-foot equivalent units), that would equal a decline in freight traffic of between 640,000-800,000 containers, and lead to decreased crane operations at the ports, lower fees that could be collected, and declines in container pick-ups and transports by trucks, rails, and to warehouses for storage.

The World Trade Organization warned on Wednesday that the outlook for global trade has “deteriorated sharply” in the wake of Trump’s tariffs plan. JB Hunt shares hit their lowest level since November 2020 after commentary during the trucking company’s earnings call about the uncertainty from tariffs.
Glad those longshoremen went on strike and had their union boss cozy up with Trump during the election.
This can’t be right, China were gonna have to pay all those tariffs and it was gonna make the US a whole bunch of money….  /s

The ripple effects of this are really pretty insane. So much of the global economy is built on just in time supply chains, with a heavy reliance on the US as a key consumer.  Now organizations need to route everything around the US and build  new lines. In some cases they will find cost savings over US centric models and never return. In others, it will be just be more expense for everyone. No one trusts this is a long term thing, but the threat is existential for too many companies to do nothing. However, there will continued dynamic shifts well into 2026 because of these stupid tariffs.
We have to be winning now, right?

The fallout goes far beyond shipping. I'm a sales rep and my number one line is a handbag line made in China. If they go under, I'm out 40% of my income. I also have other lines with product sourced from China. I have a Canadian line that will be hit with a 30% tariff as of May 1st, when the de minimus rule is cancelled. I'm sure my sales of their products will plummet.

I'm starting to get announcements from vendors of upcoming price increases or tariff surcharges. One surcharge will be 18%.

To sum it all up...I'm screwed.

Im in construction and there is a lot of disruption right now in the construction industry with these tariffs. Not even to mention the mass deportations and flat out threats of rendition of Hispanic workers. 

Trump is really screwing the pooch.
Americans are going to suffer real inflation soon.
The layoffs are going to be huge in a ripple effect

posts.title: Missing toddler who walked 7 miles alone through Arizona wilderness led to safety by rancher's dog
top_comments:
"I got in my truck to go to town and I see Buford walking down the side of the fence with a little blond kid with him. I had heard about the missing child this morning, so I knew it was him."


Buford, (best name ever), probably only walked with him about a mile, but the dog did find him.
I hope Buford got a nice treat for being a good boy.
the goodest of good boys.
7 miles for a 2 year old!

I have a Pyrenees mix (Buford is a full Pyr) and they are one of the smartest and self-sufficient dog breeds.  They can make decisions on their own and I can believe the doggo worked out that the kid shouldn't have been there and that the best thing to do was to lead him home, like a sheep.  They are also hard headed and stubborn, because they believe they are smarter than we are...
Cause dogs are awesome.
It followed me home, dad, can I keep him?
Great to read a positive story with a good ending

I have an Anatolian Pyrenees! Also known as a Colorado Mountain Dog. 

Great with kids, protective and suspicious of anything else they don’t know.
God I love dogs. I wish more humans were more like dogs.

posts.title: Two infants die of whooping cough in Louisiana as cases climb nationally
top_comments: If only there were a way to stop it.
it's like a revival of all the sicknesses

It's sad for the children who die because it is so obviously preventable.  Kids can't control whether or not their parents are anti vaxxers.   As for any parent who has a child who dies because you decided to not vaccinate them, I have zero sympathy.  

Clearly there are parts of the population who for various reasons cannot be vaccinated, such as immunocompromized.  That's understandable and legitimate in my opinion
Pregnant people can get the TDaP vaccine during each pregnancy to give their baby some protection when they're too young to be vaccinated.
Measles, whooping cough. Conservatives are getting what they wanted. The good old days are coming back.
I want to stop playing The Oregon Trail for real now, please.
I had whooping cough as a kid at 1 and then 2 years old. My parents told me it's no joke.
This just gets worse day by day

I have a question for you all. I'm a Middle School teacher at a private school in the US. I learned the other day that there are unvaccinated kids at our school. Do I have the right to demand who those kids are?
We are making America so fucking great.

posts.title: Boarding passes and check-in could be scrapped in air travel shake-up
top_comments:
Unfortunately, there are actually people who don’t live digital lives who still travel. Are they actually proposing they can’t travel?

I will say, that I have US Global Entry. When I fly back to the US, the terminal recognizes me before I even get to the kiosk. And it tells me to move along. The CBP agent then just asked me if I’m me, and waves me through. No passport checking or duty declaration unless I need to. It feels almost too easy.
Nice that they are trying to speed up boarding but this is going to blowup since face recognition has severe problems with people of darker skin tones.

posts.title: NHS will be pursued if gender policies don't change, equalities watchdog says
top_comments:
How long until a trans man or cis woman who looks masculine or is just tall is harassed in a hospital when in a bathroom or ward

Edit or cases where cis women are placed in mens jails https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/woman-held-male-prison-scotland-b2636786.html

You people wonder why we oppose “reasonable” policies like trans athlete and bathroom bans. It was always a beachhead into broader attacks on trans rights, which are themselves a beachhead to reinforcing traditional gender roles more broadly.

Of course here in the US it’s even broader than that. Trump is cancelling federal education funds for entire states because of trans rights protections that affect less than a dozen students; something they’ve always wanted to do but have heretofore lacked an excuse for. The UK isn’t quite that insane yet, but it might be if they embrace the new boogie man to the extent that we have.
Horrible. The world is going backwards. If we don’t fight against it, everyone would lose their right slowly slowly. Equity is about rights for everyone.

can't wait to get outed and humiliated to/by a bunch of strangers during whatever horrible event next leads to being hospitalised.

i love how half the people celebrating the supreme court ruling were pretending it had absolutely no impact on trans people's rights or access to public life whilst the other half are celebrating that they'll be outed, humiliated and lost the access they've had for the last 20+ years. it can't be both.
I’m not convinced that biological sex necessarily equals the sex indicated on a birth certificate. The issuance of a GRC is done on much stricter terms than assigning sex at birth.

>"Single-sex services like changing rooms must be based on biological sex if a male person is allowed to use - it's no longer a single sex space."

Why does it sound like single-sex services/spaces are female-exclusive? Does it mean cis women and trans-men are allowed to continue to use male restrooms?

posts.title: Trade war fallout: Cancellations of Chinese freight ships begin as bookings plummet
top_comments:
This is the fault of Congress. 

For four years Trump was able to make irrational demands and Congress obeyed with no question or hesitation. So Trump and his team just assumed that other nations would bow down just as easily also. 

But, unlike our spineless congress, other nations are not going to sacrifice their citizens or destroy themselves just to appease a bully.

A total of 80 blank, or canceled, sailings out of China have been recorded by freight company HLS Group. It wrote in a recent note to clients that with the trade war between China and the U.S. leading to a demand plummet, carriers have started to suspend or adjust transpacific services.

The impact of the diminished freight container traffic to North America will be significant for many links in the economy and supply chain, including the ports and logistics companies moving the freight. If each sailing was carrying 8,000 to 10,000 TEUs (twenty-foot equivalent units), that would equal a decline in freight traffic of between 640,000-800,000 containers, and lead to decreased crane operations at the ports, lower fees that could be collected, and declines in container pick-ups and transports by trucks, rails, and to warehouses for storage.

The World Trade Organization warned on Wednesday that the outlook for global trade has “deteriorated sharply” in the wake of Trump’s tariffs plan. JB Hunt shares hit their lowest level since November 2020 after commentary during the trucking company’s earnings call about the uncertainty from tariffs.
Glad those longshoremen went on strike and had their union boss cozy up with Trump during the election.
This can’t be right, China were gonna have to pay all those tariffs and it was gonna make the US a whole bunch of money….  /s

The ripple effects of this are really pretty insane. So much of the global economy is built on just in time supply chains, with a heavy reliance on the US as a key consumer.  Now organizations need to route everything around the US and build  new lines. In some cases they will find cost savings over US centric models and never return. In others, it will be just be more expense for everyone. No one trusts this is a long term thing, but the threat is existential for too many companies to do nothing. However, there will continued dynamic shifts well into 2026 because of these stupid tariffs.
We have to be winning now, right?

The fallout goes far beyond shipping. I'm a sales rep and my number one line is a handbag line made in China. If they go under, I'm out 40% of my income. I also have other lines with product sourced from China. I have a Canadian line that will be hit with a 30% tariff as of May 1st, when the de minimus rule is cancelled. I'm sure my sales of their products will plummet.

I'm starting to get announcements from vendors of upcoming price increases or tariff surcharges. One surcharge will be 18%.

posts.title: Congestion pricing is working': MTA says tolls keeping 82k drivers a day out of Manhattan
top_comments: Wait…What happened to “congestion pricing is dead. Long live the king!”?
For me driving in Manhattan was enough to keep me from driving in Manhattan. What a nightmare.

I was just in the city the other week and the amount of cars was WAY down. It was noticable. But you know what? The town was still busy as hell and taxis, subways and busses were moving right along. The people that needed or wanted to be there were there.
$9 per day sounds pretty reasonable. Was that all that was required to deter 2.5 million vehicles compared to last March?
Wait, it's working? I assume Trump will immediately try to end it.
The Trump administration literally just wants to undo everything good, it's fucking disgusting

I was pissed when I heard about this being implemented, being an out-of-towner going to NYC is already an expensive affair with all the tolled highways, bridges and tunnels. But it was the first time ever that I was able to drive into Manhattan and not feel like I was suffocating in traffic. I was even able to find free parking on like 48th st. Nuts.

This has my full support.

As a person who drives a car (and isn't made of money), I hate the idea of congestion pricing.

As a person who hates traffic and doesn't like pollution, I love the idea of congestion pricing.

I've got mixed feelings about it, but if it works it works I suppose?
I just hope that the MTA uses this money wisely.

Ongoing case: [https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69652290/metropolitan-transportation-authority-v-duffy/](https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69652290/metropolitan-transportation-authority-v-duffy/)

One of at least 195 against this administration ... [https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/](https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/)

posts.title: The mysterious firing of a Chinese professor has Asian students on edge: ‘Brings chills to our spines’ | US politics
top_comments:
*“What is particularly troubling in this case is that Indiana University fired him and his wife without due process, presuming guilt instead of innocence,” Chen says.*

Yeah, and fired by email on the very day DHS operatives swooped down upon the campus. No wonder Chinese students are living in fear, and are readying to leave the US on a moment's notice.

US is inevitably going to create a second [Qian Xuesen \(Tsien Hsue-shen\)](https://www.galcit.caltech.edu/about/legends-of-galcit/qian-xuesen-tsien-hsue-shen).

For those out of the loop, China's nuclear program, missile program, and space program only exist because the US accused Dr. Qian of being a communist spy and deported him to China.

posts.title: US IRS planning to rescind Harvard's tax-exempt status
top_comments: This is going to be drawn out in court for a long time. Harvard isn't likely to back down.

Isn't it illegal for the president to get the IRS to do that?

"Prohibition on executive branch influence over taxpayer audits and other investigations"

[Stated here](https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/26/7217)
All is fair then when the shoe is on the other foot...every church that participated in preaching about voting (at all for anyone) should lose their tax exempt status too
That's great! That means the next time we have a democratic president in we can just start pulling the tax exempt status of churches right? Just whomever we don't like?

Remember when conservatives cried persecution because the IRS showed extra scrutiny to conservative groups based on keyword usage? (The IRS also did the same for liberal groups as well but conservatives just ignored that since it didn't support their worldview)
How about megachurches next?
"The essence of fascism is to make laws forbidding everything and then enforce them selectively against your enemies." - John Lescroart, A Plague of Secrets.
Harvard may know some lawyers who can represent them in court.

Oh, good.  The dollar is collapsing, U.S. bonds are becoming more unstable and disfavored globally every day, stock market volatility is off the charts with every indication that the bottom is going to fall out, the FED chairman just cautioned that Trump's tariffs are putting the country on track for devastating stagflation ... and instead of dealing with any of this the White House is hyper-focused on abusing the power of the federal government to exact petty retributions against perceived political enemies.  Any Trump supporters want to defend this daily shitshow?

I'm very glad Harvard decided to be the one to stick out its neck. I was having conversations with my former colleagues at smaller state universities at the R2 level. Many wanted to defy the federal government but did not have the resource to do so. Now that Harvard did this and MIT followed suit, a lot more universities can just follow their footsteps. White House cannot possibly target every single college.

posts.title: Trump administration plans to end the IRS Direct File program for free tax filing, AP sources say
top_comments:
*"Republican lawmakers and commercial tax preparation companies complained it was a waste of taxpayer money"*  

The places that are making money from filing taxes and selling peoples information are saying it's a waste of taxpayer money.   As a taxpayer I disagree with them.

“We want the worst for everyone!”

“We are just plain evil”

> The program developed during Joe Biden’s presidency was credited by users with making tax filing easy, fast and economical. But Republican lawmakers and commercial tax preparation companies complained it was a waste of taxpayer money because free filing programs already exist, although they are hard to use.

People who like this software: users

People who don’t: Republican lawmakers and tax preparation software companies (TurboTax)

Pick a side, folks.
What if I just don't do my taxes correctly like him?

MAGA : Let's remove DirectFile, which people like and makes sense.

MAGA : Let's not go after TurboTax though, which is outright scamming us.
Every decision, the benefit of our enemies.
I filed my taxes with this in less than 30 minutes and got my return in less than week. Obviously its a terrible inefficient program that needs to go. /s
It cost $100 to file taxes under H&R Block services. That is insane when the IRS already has our information! It’s ridiculous.
I wonder how much Intuit and H&R Block paid for this. It doesn't help anyone but them to get rid of this service.
Been using freetaxusa
